issue.title: www.myhomenetwork.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.myhomenetwork.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.myhomenetwork.com) ### Comment Username: `@maiseld` > I am running AdGaurd home on a Raspberry Pi on my home network. > > It should be throwing every ad url into a sinkhole (0.0.0.0), but instead I am still getting ads for sites like Youtube, (and maybe some others, but mostly Youtube). > > I'm trying to figure out what I am doing wrong. How do I block Youtube ads? Btw this is the Youtube site, not the mobile app. I suspect Youtube may be trying to stream the ad through the IP:Port that is working for me, so I know it is a constant battle to block them. > > If all the data from the internet is running through my Adblock DNS (which I configured on my router) before it gets to my router, than it should be working properly. > > Also my home network is using two routers: 1) which connects to the internet and 2) a secondary router that connects to the first one via WDS. My devices are connected to the secondary router. I will check my secondary router if it is configured with the correct DNS settings, but I think it is. And even if it wasn't configured, that shouldn't affect AdGaurd home's function from blocking the ads correct? > > Any ideas of what I am doing wrong? Anything I need to configure on my AdGaurd home page? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/6k01cjr.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard Home Browser: | All of them Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | None, the issue persists on all browsers

Hello @TravisMWeaver

I wasn't able to reproduce the issue with your settings.

1. Please go to settings > Safari > extensions, disable all AdGuard extensions and enable them again.
2. Go to the AdGuard app and update the filters, wait 2-3 minutes without closing the app.
3. Reboot your device
4. Go to this site and check for ads, there shouldn't be any.

If this does not help, please contact our support: support@adguard.com

### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.myhomenetwork.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.myhomenetwork.com) ### Comment Username: `@maiseld` > I am running AdGaurd home on a Raspberry Pi on my home network. > > It should be throwing every ad url into a sinkhole (0.0.0.0), but instead I am still getting ads for sites like Youtube, (and maybe some others, but mostly Youtube). > > I'm trying to figure out what I am doing wrong. How do I block Youtube ads? Btw this is the Youtube site, not the mobile app. I suspect Youtube may be trying to stream the ad through the IP:Port that is working for me, so I know it is a constant battle to block them. > > If all the data from the internet is running through my Adblock DNS (which I configured on my router) before it gets to my router, than it should be working properly. > > Also my home network is using two routers: 1) which connects to the internet and 2) a secondary router that connects to the first one via WDS. My devices are connected to the secondary router. I will check my secondary router if it is configured with the correct DNS settings, but I think it is. And even if it wasn't configured, that shouldn't affect AdGaurd home's function from blocking the ads correct? > > Any ideas of what I am doing wrong? Anything I need to configure on my AdGaurd home page? ### Screenshots

comment.body:
> How do I block Youtube ads?

Unfortunately, DNS blocking is not enough. However, you can block YouTube ads (not mobile app, [but there is another way](https://kb.adguard.com/en/android/solving-problems/youtube-ads)) using our extension or app.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.myhomenetwork.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.myhomenetwork.com) ### Comment Username: `@maiseld` > I am running AdGaurd home on a Raspberry Pi on my home network. > > It should be throwing every ad url into a sinkhole (0.0.0.0), but instead I am still getting ads for sites like Youtube, (and maybe some others, but mostly Youtube). > > I'm trying to figure out what I am doing wrong. How do I block Youtube ads? Btw this is the Youtube site, not the mobile app. I suspect Youtube may be trying to stream the ad through the IP:Port that is working for me, so I know it is a constant battle to block them. > > If all the data from the internet is running through my Adblock DNS (which I configured on my router) before it gets to my router, than it should be working properly. > > Also my home network is using two routers: 1) which connects to the internet and 2) a secondary router that connects to the first one via WDS. My devices are connected to the secondary router. I will check my secondary router if it is configured with the correct DNS settings, but I think it is. And even if it wasn't configured, that shouldn't affect AdGaurd home's function from blocking the ads correct? > > Any ideas of what I am doing wrong? Anything I need to configure on my AdGaurd home page? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/6k01cjr.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard Home Browser: | All of them Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | None, the issue persists on all browsers

comment.body:
zloyden,

Can you provide a technical explanation as to why DNS blocking from Ad Guard home does not block Youtube ads from Youtube in a browser?

I want to be able to run one thing, use any browser, from any device in my home, and use Youtube without ads. Please explain why that is not possible.

comment.body:
Could you please try to add this set of rule(s) to user rules and check if issue still occurs?

Rule:
```adblock
@@||passport.baidu.com/passApi/$stealth
```
or (if rule above will not work, please remove previous rule):
```adblock
@@||passport.baidu.com/v*/*api$stealth
```
or both:
```adblock
@@||passport.baidu.com/passApi/$stealth
@@||passport.baidu.com/v*/*api$stealth
```
or in case if rules above will not work just:
```adblock
@@||passport.baidu.com^$stealth
```

comment.body:
The problem is that after clicking on the `Sign in` button, the login popup doesn't show up.

I'm not sure which cause the problem. In my Windows, it is caused by `hide your referrer from third-parties`, as I mentioned. But on my Mac, I can't reproduce the problem, too.

issue.title: www.myhomenetwork.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.myhomenetwork.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.myhomenetwork.com) ### Comment Username: `@maiseld` > I am running AdGaurd home on a Raspberry Pi on my home network. > > It should be throwing every ad url into a sinkhole (0.0.0.0), but instead I am still getting ads for sites like Youtube, (and maybe some others, but mostly Youtube). > > I'm trying to figure out what I am doing wrong. How do I block Youtube ads? Btw this is the Youtube site, not the mobile app. I suspect Youtube may be trying to stream the ad through the IP:Port that is working for me, so I know it is a constant battle to block them. > > If all the data from the internet is running through my Adblock DNS (which I configured on my router) before it gets to my router, than it should be working properly. > > Also my home network is using two routers: 1) which connects to the internet and 2) a secondary router that connects to the first one via WDS. My devices are connected to the secondary router. I will check my secondary router if it is configured with the correct DNS settings, but I think it is. And even if it wasn't configured, that shouldn't affect AdGaurd home's function from blocking the ads correct? > > Any ideas of what I am doing wrong? Anything I need to configure on my AdGaurd home page? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/6k01cjr.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard Home Browser: | All of them Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | None, the issue persists on all browsers

comment.body:
Okay, that makes sense. Thanks for that explanation.

Still, I wish that somehow when I use Adgaurd Home on my Raspberry Pi - it was able to know the URL of the webpage that a device on my network is requesting, and also somehow was able to "inspect" the source code of the webpages before it got to my computer, however at that layer its really all just signal/data and not the uncompiled code - so that wouldn't work..... unless the webpage was "tested" on the Raspberry Pi first, and somehow buffered the video, and then sent the "clean" video to the requesting device on my network.

I don't know if you guys have such technology.

Or perhaps there's like an AdGaurd-type application on my PC (and each device) that works for all browsers, rather than me having to install an extension on each one?

issue.title: www.myhomenetwork.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.myhomenetwork.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.myhomenetwork.com) ### Comment Username: `@maiseld` > I am running AdGaurd home on a Raspberry Pi on my home network. > > It should be throwing every ad url into a sinkhole (0.0.0.0), but instead I am still getting ads for sites like Youtube, (and maybe some others, but mostly Youtube). > > I'm trying to figure out what I am doing wrong. How do I block Youtube ads? Btw this is the Youtube site, not the mobile app. I suspect Youtube may be trying to stream the ad through the IP:Port that is working for me, so I know it is a constant battle to block them. > > If all the data from the internet is running through my Adblock DNS (which I configured on my router) before it gets to my router, than it should be working properly. > > Also my home network is using two routers: 1) which connects to the internet and 2) a secondary router that connects to the first one via WDS. My devices are connected to the secondary router. I will check my secondary router if it is configured with the correct DNS settings, but I think it is. And even if it wasn't configured, that shouldn't affect AdGaurd home's function from blocking the ads correct? > > Any ideas of what I am doing wrong? Anything I need to configure on my AdGaurd home page? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/6k01cjr.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard Home Browser: | All of them Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | None, the issue persists on all browsers

comment.body:
Yes, it's like @BrunaPitanga said - such blocking will be the incorrect one. Actually, the YouTube ads are complicated ones and we have another solution in AdGuard Extra. This approach means filtering the DOM of the page and other requests.

> Still, I wish that somehow when I use Adgaurd Home on my Raspberry Pi

I'm not sure if we have this, it's better to ask in [AdGuard Home repo](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardHome). You can create an issue with your questions or I can address them there.

> Or perhaps there's like an AdGaurd-type application on my PC (and each device) that works for all browsers, rather than me having to install an extension on each one?

We have the app for desktop and mobile platforms, so you can install it and filter browsers. It also supports our extensions like mentioned AdGuard Extra.

comment.body:
К сожалению, мы не можем воспроизвести проблему с вашими настройками.

1. Зайдите, пожалуйста, в настройки > Safari > расширения, отключите все расширения AdGuard и включите снова.
2. Зайдите в приложение AdGuard и обновите фильтры, подождите 2-3 минуты не закрывая приложение.
3. Перезагрузите устройство
4. Зайдите на этот сайт и проверьте наличие рекламы, ее быть не должно.

Если реклама останется, обратитесь в нашу поддержку support@adguard.com

issue.title: www.duden.de

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: By Design
labels.description: The issue cannot be resolved due to technical, ethic, or legal reasons

issue.body:
## Information

### Deutsch

Sehr geehrte Benutzerin, sehr geehrter Benutzer, aufgrund von Gesetzen ([z. B. die Gerichtsentscheidung in Karlsruhe, Deutschland im Jahre 2018](https://www.morgenpost.de/wirtschaft/article214069831/Karlsruhe-erlaubt-Werbeblocker.html)) ist es leider nicht möglich diese Paywall (Adblock-Erkennung) zu umgehen. Vielen Dank für Ihr Verständnis.

### English

Dear user, due to a court decision ([eg the court ruling in Karlsruhe, Germany in 2018](https://www.morgenpost.de/wirtschaft/article214069831/Karlsruhe-erlaubt-Werbeblocker.html) ) it is unfortunately not possible to bypass this paywall (adblock detection). Thank you for your understanding.

comment.body:
### Внимание

Эта проблема решается с помощью расширения [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra).

Если вы используете AdGuard для Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включен в настройках программы.

Если вы используете браузерное расширение AdGuard, мы рекомендуем установить AdGuard Extra в дополнение к нему.

* [Установить в Chrome, Edge или другой браузер на основе Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установить в Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: www.myhomenetwork.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://www.myhomenetwork.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.myhomenetwork.com) ### Comment Username: `@maiseld` > I am running AdGaurd home on a Raspberry Pi on my home network. > > It should be throwing every ad url into a sinkhole (0.0.0.0), but instead I am still getting ads for sites like Youtube, (and maybe some others, but mostly Youtube). > > I'm trying to figure out what I am doing wrong. How do I block Youtube ads? Btw this is the Youtube site, not the mobile app. I suspect Youtube may be trying to stream the ad through the IP:Port that is working for me, so I know it is a constant battle to block them. > > If all the data from the internet is running through my Adblock DNS (which I configured on my router) before it gets to my router, than it should be working properly. > > Also my home network is using two routers: 1) which connects to the internet and 2) a secondary router that connects to the first one via WDS. My devices are connected to the secondary router. I will check my secondary router if it is configured with the correct DNS settings, but I think it is. And even if it wasn't configured, that shouldn't affect AdGaurd home's function from blocking the ads correct? > > Any ideas of what I am doing wrong? Anything I need to configure on my AdGaurd home page? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/6k01cjr.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | AdGuard Home Browser: | All of them Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | None, the issue persists on all browsers

comment.body:
Thanks for those links. Yep you can't block content if you cannot decrypt and see it.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardHome#comparison-limitations
Here they say they plan to add a content-blocking proxy to AdGaurd home, essentially a reverse proxy like I was describing. Following the thread, I don't think it's complete yet.
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardHome/issues/1228
But someone developed this
https://github.com/Barre/privaxy
Which seems to be a proxy offered outside of the home network? (But provides VPN and Ad Blocking). I hope that they might use this to integrate it into Ad Gaurd.

And I know they are busy... I can use the other solutions in the meantime.
